分别	to part; to leave each other; to distinguish; to tell apart; difference; distinction; in different ways; differently; separately; individually	我们要分别走了，希望很快再见面。	We have to part ways now, hope to see you again soon.	这两种花在颜色上有很明显的分别。	There is a clear distinction in color between these two flowers.	他们分别用不同的方式庆祝生日。	They celebrate their birthdays in different ways.
馬	v. Horse. Bookmarked. This Internet slang term is used when you save a social media post for later perusal. 馬 [mǎ] and 碼 [mǎ ] are homophones.	这篇文章很有意思，我要马上收藏起来。	This article is very interesting, I want to bookmark it right away.	她把这个视频马了起来，打算晚点再看。	She bookmarked this video and plans to watch it later.	我经常把一些有用的信息马起来，方便以后查看。	I often bookmark useful information for later reference.
翻紅	v. Flip+red. To become popular again. This Internet slang term is often used to describe the public’s renewed interest in celebrity has-beens.	这位艺人最近因一部新电影再次翻红。	This artist has become popular again recently because of a new movie.	这首歌曲在网络上翻红了。	This song has become popular again on the internet.	他的表演让他再次翻红。	His performance has made him popular again.
周邊	n. Peripheral [products. ] Merchandise produced to take advantage of a related work or a celebrity featured in the work. A tie-in or spin-off.	这部电影的周边产品非常畅销。	The peripheral products of this movie are very popular.	她收集了很多这个明星的周边商品。	She has collected a lot of peripheral products of this celebrity.	这个展览会上有很多与动漫相关的周边产品。	There are many peripheral products related to anime at this exhibition.
上门	to drop in; to visit; to lock a door; (of a shop) to close; to go and live with one's wife's family, in effect becoming a member of her family	他经常上门拜访我们。	He often drops in to visit us.	今天下午有人上门来送包裹。	Someone will drop by this afternoon to deliver a package.	他们决定上门道歉。	They decided to drop in and apologize.
霸屏	v. To occupy the screen. You use this Internet slang term to describe an actor whose works you can see everywhere on TV and in movie theaters.	这部电视剧让男主角霸屏了。	The male lead of this TV series is dominating the screen.	最近她的广告霸屏了各大电视台。	Her commercials have been dominating major TV stations recently.	他的新电影让他再次霸屏。	His new movie has put him back in the limelight.
重口味	strong flavor (spicy, salty etc); (of food) strongly flavored; (of a person) having a preference for strong flavors; (slang) intense; hardcore	他的烹饪风格很重口味。	His cooking style is very intense.	这家餐厅的菜很重口味，不适合所有人。	The food in this restaurant is very intense and not suitable for everyone.	他是一个重口味的影迷，喜欢看血腥的恐怖片。	He is a hardcore movie fan who likes to watch gory horror films.
站台	platform (at a railway station); (Tw) (of an influential person) to publicly lend one's support (e.g. for an election candidate); (Tw) website	请在站台等候火车。	Please wait for the train on the platform.	他站台支持了这位候选人。	He publicly supported this candidate.	这个网站是他站台的。	This website has his public support.

让	to yield; to permit; to let sb do sth; to have sb do sth; to make sb (feel sad etc); by (indicates the agent in a passive clause, like 被[bei4])	老师让学生们做作业。	The teacher lets the students do their homework.	这个决定让他感到很难过。	This decision makes him very sad.	他被让去参加比赛。	He was made to participate in the competition.
逼	to force (sb to do sth); to compel; to press for; to extort; to press on towards; to press up to; to close in on; euphemistic variant of 屄[bi1]	他们逼我做我不想做的事情。	They forced me to do something I didn't want to do.	警察逼他交出了真相。	The police compelled him to tell the truth.	公司逼他签下了合同。	The company pressed him to sign the contract.
沖鴨	v. Run+duck. This Internet slang is a cute alternative to 沖呀  [chōng ya] “Run, go go go,” a way of encouraging people to cheer up or work hard.	今天的比赛加油沖鴨！	Cheer up and run for it in today's game!	老板对员工说：“沖鴨，我们一定能完成任务！”	The boss said to the employees, "Come on, we can definitely complete the task!"	考试加油沖鴨，你一定能取得好成绩的！	Keep it up in the exam, you will definitely get good results!
走腎	adj. Walk+kidney. Going through the kidney. Adapted from 走心 [zǒu xīn], this Internet slang term refers to something that causes sexual arousal.	那个笑话真走肾！	That joke is really arousing!	这首歌的歌词走肾，让人听了很有感觉。	The lyrics of this song are very arousing and make people feel a lot.	这部电影的情节走肾，很容易引起观众的共鸣。	The plot of this movie is very arousing and easily resonates with the audience.
问候	to give one's respects; to send a greeting; (fig.) (coll.) to make offensive reference to (somebody dear to the person to whom one is speaking)	他每天都会问候邻居。	He greets the neighbors every day.	请代我向你的父母问候。	Please give my regards to your parents.	他的言论无疑是对我的问候。	His remarks are undoubtedly an offensive reference to me.
我宣你	~= 我喜歡你 [wǒ xǐ huān nǐ] Expression.. This Internet slang phrase is a cute way of saying “I like/dig/love you” with a Taiwanese Mandarin accent.	今天的表现很棒，我宣你！	You did great today, I like you!	她的笑容真迷人，我宣你！	Her smile is so charming, I love you!	你的帮助真的太大了，我宣你！	Your help is really great, I dig you!
虐狗	v. To abuse [single] dogs. To deliberately or unknowingly tease or hurt the single people through public displayed affection online or offline.	他们的甜蜜照片总是虐狗。	Their sweet photos always tease the singles.	别在单身朋友面前太过甜蜜，容易虐狗。	Don't be too sweet in front of single friends, it's easy to tease them.	她的恩爱行为总是虐狗，让单身的人感到难过。	Her lovey-dovey behavior always teases the singles and makes them feel sad.
章程	rules; regulations; constitution; statute; articles of association (of company); articles of incorporation; charter (of a corporation); by-laws	公司的章程规定了员工的权利和义务。	The company's by-laws stipulate the rights and obligations of the employees.	这个组织的章程需要经常更新。	The constitution of this organization needs to be updated regularly.	我们必须遵守学校的章程。	We must abide by the school's regulations.
关	mountain pass; to close; to shut; to turn off; to confine; to lock (sb) up; to shut (sb in a room, a bird in a cage etc); to concern; to involve	他关了窗户。	He closed the window.	请把门关上。	Please shut the door.	这个问题关系到我们的未来。	This issue concerns our future.
快	rapid; quick; speed; rate; soon; almost; to make haste; clever; sharp (of knives or wits); forthright; plainspoken; gratified; pleased; pleasant	他跑得很快。	He runs very fast.	快点，我们要迟到了！	Hurry up, we're going to be late!	她的反应很快。	Her reaction is very quick.

位	position; location; place; seat; classifier for people (honorific); classifier for binary bits (e.g. 十六位 16-bit or 2 bytes); (physics) potential	他在公司担任重要的位子。	He holds an important position in the company.	请你在这个位子上坐一下。	Please sit in this seat for a moment.	这个位子的潜力很大。	This position has great potential.
不喜勿噴	<Expression> If you don’t like [what I’m saying], don’t rant [against me]. This expression is often used before expressing one’s opinion online.	我认为这部电影很无聊，不喜勿噴。	I think this movie is boring, if you don't like it, don't rant.	这个观点可能会引起争议，不喜勿噴。	This viewpoint may cause controversy, if you don't like it, don't rant.	不喜勿噴，这只是我的个人看法。	If you don't like it, don't rant, this is just my personal opinion.
关	mountain pass; to close; to shut; to turn off; to confine; to lock (sb) up; to shut (sb in a room, a bird in a cage etc); to concern; to involve	他把门关上了。	He closed the door.	这个问题关系到我们的未来。	This issue concerns our future.	他们关在一个小房间里。	They are locked up in a small room.
主持	to take charge of; to manage or direct; to preside over; to uphold; to stand for (justice etc); to host (a TV or radio program etc); (TV) anchor	她主持了这个会议。	She presided over the meeting.	他主持了这个节目。	He hosted this program.	我们需要一个有经验的人来主持这个项目。	We need an experienced person to take charge of this project.
活久見	<Expression> Live+long+see. If you live long enough, you will be able to witness all kinds of things (however unbelievable or bizarre they are).	这种事情我还是第一次听说，活久見。	This is the first time I've heard of such a thing, live long and see.	他们竟然和好了，活久見。	They actually made up, live long and see.	这个世界上的事情真是活久見。	Things in this world are truly live long and see.
主动	to take the initiative; to do sth of one's own accord; spontaneous; active; opposite: passive 被動|被动[bei4 dong4]; drive (of gears and shafts etc)	他总是很主动地帮助别人。	He always takes the initiative to help others.	她是一个很主动的人。	She is a very proactive person.	在这个项目中，我们需要更主动一些。	In this project, we need to be more proactive.
灰常	~= 非常 [fēi cháng] Gray+usual. Very, extremely.. This Internet slang term is a humorous way of saying 非常 [fēi cháng] “very” with a Fujian accent.	这个菜灰常好吃。	This dish is extremely delicious.	她灰常喜欢这首歌。	She really likes this song.	今天的天气灰常糟糕。	Today's weather is very bad.
人物	person; personage; figure (esp. sb of importance); character (in a play, novel etc); figure painting (as a genre of traditional Chinese painting)	这部电影的人物塑造很成功。	The character portrayal in this movie is very successful.	他是一个历史上重要的人物。	He is an important figure in history.	这个小说的人物形象很丰富。	The characters in this novel are very rich.
情懷	n. Sentiment. This Internet slang term is used to describe one’s passion about something bigger than oneself. Sometimes it is used sarcastically.	他对音乐有着很深的情懷。	He has a deep passion for music.	她的画作充满了浓厚的情懷。	Her paintings are full of strong sentiment.	这个团队有着对事业的高度情懷。	This team has a high level of passion for the cause.
黑歷史	n. Black+history. One’s disgraceful past. Sometimes it is used humorously to describe one’s embarrassing experiences when he or she was a rookie.	他的黑歷史被人知道了。	His disgraceful past was known to others.	每个人都有自己的黑歷史。	Everyone has their own disgraceful past.	小时候的黑歷史总是让人忍俊不禁。	The embarrassing experiences from childhood always make people can't help but laugh.

噴子	n. Literally “sprayers,” this Internet slang term means Internet trolls, or people who make deliberately offensive or provocative online postings	他是一个专业的噴子，经常在网上挑衅别人。	He is a professional Internet troll, often provoking others online.	别理那些噴子，他们只是想引起争端。	Don't pay attention to those Internet trolls, they just want to stir up controversy.	这个论坛上有很多噴子，总是发一些不友好的言论。	There are many Internet trolls on this forum, always making unfriendly comments.
原著黨	n. The original work party. Fans of the original works, especially fans of the original Internet novels which are adapted into TV dramas or movies	她是原著黨，对于改编的电视剧总是有很多意见。	She is a fan of the original works, and always has a lot of opinions about the adapted TV dramas.	原著黨们对于小说改编成电影有很高的期待。	Fans of the original works have high expectations for novels being adapted into movies.	原著黨们总是喜欢和其他读者分享小说的细节。	Fans of the original works always like to share the details of the novels with other readers.
想	to think (about); to think of; to devise; to think (that); to believe (that); to desire; to want (to); to miss (feel wistful about the absence of)	我想你了。	I miss you.	我想明天去看电影。	I want to go see a movie tomorrow.	我想一下怎么回答这个问题。	Let me think about how to answer this question.
上网	to go online; to connect to the Internet; (of a document etc) to be uploaded to the Internet; (tennis, volleyball etc) to move in close to the net	我每天晚上都会上网看新闻。	I go online to read the news every night.	他正在上网查资料。	He is online searching for information.	上网购物已经成为一种时尚。	Online shopping has become a fashion.
諾蘭黑	n./adj. Nolan+black. Christopher Nolan detractors. This Internet slang term is used to describe people who dislike Christopher Nolan’s film style.	諾蘭黑们认为他的电影总是太复杂了。	Christopher Nolan detractors think his movies are always too complicated.	她不是諾蘭黑，只是觉得他的电影不太适合自己。	She is not a Christopher Nolan detractor, she just feels that his movies are not quite suitable for her.	諾蘭黑们总是批评他的电影风格。	Christopher Nolan detractors always criticize his film style.
點讚之交	n. Click+like+acquaintances. People who maintain a minimal connection or their friendship superficially by liking each other’s social media posts.	他们只是点赞之交，现实生活中并不熟悉。	They are just click+like+acquaintances, not familiar with each other in real life.	现在很多人的友谊都是点赞之交。	Many people's friendships nowadays are superficially maintained by liking each other's posts.	她和他只是点赞之交，没有深入的交流。	She and he are just click+like+acquaintances, without deep communication.
放空	to relax completely; to empty one's mind; (finance) to sell short; (of a commercial vehicle) to travel empty (no cargo or passengers); to deadhead	周末的时候，我喜欢放空，什么都不想。	On weekends, I like to relax completely and not think about anything.	她在海边放空，享受大自然的美好。	She relaxes completely at the beach, enjoying the beauty of nature.	他需要一段时间放空，让自己的身心得到放松。	He needs some time to relax completely and let his body and mind relax.
本寶寶	n. I, the baby. Referring to oneself as a baby. This Internet slang term is used by young people to play cute. (Digital illustration by Kim Smith)	本寶寶今天很开心。	I, the baby, am very happy today.	她喜欢用本寶寶来称呼自己。	She likes to refer to herself as "I, the baby".	本寶寶不想去上班，想在家睡觉。	I, the baby, don't want to go to work, I want to sleep at home.
掀起	to lift; to raise (a lid etc); (of a storm) to surge; to stir up (waves etc); (fig.) to trigger; set off (a wave of popularity, a controversy etc)	他的演讲掀起了热烈的讨论。	His speech stirred up a heated discussion.	这部电影掀起了一股观影热潮。	This movie set off a wave of enthusiasm for watching movies.	这个问题掀起了一场激烈的争论。	This issue triggered a fierce debate.
摆脱	to break away from; to cast off (old ideas etc); to get rid of; to break away (from); to break out (of); to free oneself from; to extricate oneself	他终于摆脱了过去的困境。	He finally broke away from the past difficulties.	我们应该摆脱传统的观念，接受新的思维方式。	We should get rid of traditional ideas and accept new ways of thinking.	她努力摆脱贫困，追求更好的生活。	She is working hard to break away from poverty and pursue a better life.
word	meanings	example sentence 1	translation 1	example sentence 2	translation 2	example sentence 3	translation 3
接	to receive; to answer (the phone); to meet or welcome sb; to connect; to catch; to join; to extend; to take one's turn on duty; to take over for sb	我接到了他的来信。	I received his letter.	她接了我的电话。	She answered my call.	他接我去机场。	He picked me up and took me to the airport.
发挥	to display; to exhibit; to bring out implicit or innate qualities; to express (a thought or moral); to develop (an idea); to elaborate (on a theme)	他发挥了他的才华。	He displayed his talent.	她发挥了她的创造力。	She expressed her creativity.	我们需要发挥团队的力量。	We need to develop the team's strength.
鸟	bird; CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]; "bird" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 196); (dialect) to pay attention to; (intensifier) damned; goddamn	这只鸟在树上唱歌。	This bird is singing in the tree.	他对我完全不鸟。	He completely ignores me.	这个地方有很多鸟。	There are many birds in this place.
火	fire; urgent; ammunition; fiery or flaming; internal heat (Chinese medicine); hot (popular); classifier for military units (old); Kangxi radical 86	他们在山上生火。	They are making a fire on the mountain.	这个问题很火。	This issue is very popular.	他的脸红得像火。	His face turned as red as fire.
堵	to block up (a road, pipe etc); to stop up (a hole); (fig.) (of a person) choked up with anxiety or stress; wall (literary); (classifier for walls)	这条路被堵住了。	This road is blocked.	他因为工作压力大而感到堵。	He feels choked up due to work pressure.	这面墙很厚，是一面堵。	This wall is very thick, it's a solid wall.
小透明	n. Little+transparent. Nobody. This Internet slang term is often used by fans who don’t have a large presence in the fandom to describe themselves.	我在这个圈子里是个小透明。	I am a nobody in this circle.	她总是自称是小透明。	She always refers to herself as a nobody.	他觉得自己是个小透明。	He feels like he is a nobody.
大表姐	n. The eldest cousin sister. This Internet slang term is an affectionate nickname for American actress Jennifer Lawrence and Chinese model Liu Wen.	她是我的大表姐。	She is my eldest cousin sister.	大表姐的电影我都看过了。	I have watched all the movies of Jennifer Lawrence.	大表姐的模特秀很精彩。	Liu Wen's fashion shows are very exciting.
推	to push; to cut; to refuse; to reject; to decline; to shirk (responsibility); to put off; to delay; to push forward; to nominate; to elect; massage	他推了我一把。	He pushed me.	她推掉了我的邀请。	She declined my invitation.	我们需要推动这个项目。	We need to push forward this project.
理直气壮	in the right and self-confident (idiom); bold and confident with justice on one's side; to have the courage of one's convictions; just and forceful	他理直气壮地站了出来。	He stood up boldly and confidently.	她理直气壮地说出了真相。	She courageously spoke out the truth.	我们应该理直气壮地维护自己的权益。	We should boldly and confidently defend our rights.
word	meanings	example sentence 1	translation 1	example sentence 2	translation 2	example sentence 3	translation 3
背	the back of a body or object; to turn one's back; to hide something from; to learn by heart; to recite from memory; unlucky (slang); hard of hearing	他背对着我。	He has his back turned to me.	她背诵了一首诗。	She recited a poem from memory.	他的背很疼。	His back hurts.
抄	to make a copy; to plagiarize; to search and seize; to raid; to grab; to go off with; to take a shortcut; to make a turning move; to fold one's arms	他抄了我的作业。	He copied my homework.	警察抄了他的房子。	The police raided his house.	他抄起了衣服。	He grabbed the clothes.
电	lightning; electricity; electric (bound form); to get (or give) an electric shock; phone call or telegram etc; to send via telephone or telegram etc	我被电到了。	I got an electric shock.	他给我发了一封电子邮件。	He sent me an email.	今天下了一场电闪雷鸣的暴风雨。	There was a thunderstorm with lightning today.
尺	a Chinese foot; one-third of a meter; a ruler; a tape-measure; one of the three acupoints for measuring pulse in Chinese medicine; CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3]	这条裙子有多长？用尺量一下。	How long is this skirt? Measure it with a ruler.	他是个木工，经常用尺量东西。	He is a carpenter and often uses a tape measure.	这个地方的尺寸需要用尺来测量。	The dimensions of this place need to be measured with a ruler.
派	clique; school; group; faction; to dispatch; to send; to assign; to appoint; pi (Greek letter Ππ); the circular ratio pi = 3.1415926; (loanword) pie	我们派了一个人去调查。	We sent someone to investigate.	他是数学派的。	He belongs to the math faction.	这个团队派我去参加会议。	The team assigned me to attend the meeting.
烧	to burn; to cook; to stew; to bake; to roast; to heat; to boil (tea, water etc); fever; to run a temperature; (coll.) to let things go to one's head	他在炉子上烧了一锅汤。	He cooked a pot of soup on the stove.	她烧伤了手。	She burned her hand.	今天的太阳烧得很厉害。	The sun is scorching today.
项	back of neck; item; thing; term (in a mathematical formula); sum (of money); classifier for principles, items, clauses, tasks, research projects etc	这个项目需要很多资金。	This project requires a lot of funding.	他买了一项新技术。	He bought a new technology.	她戴着项链。	She is wearing a necklace.
逆生長	n. Reverse+growth. This Internet slang term is used to describe someone whose appearance (almost) does not show signs of aging over a span of years.	她的皮肤看起来逆生长。	Her skin looks like it's aging in reverse.	他的逆生长引起了很多关注。	His reverse growth has attracted a lot of attention.	这个明星的逆生长成为了话题。	This celebrity's reverse growth has become a topic of discussion.
黃桑	n. yellow+mulberry. Emperor. This Internet slang term is a comical way of saying 皇上 [huáng shàng] “Your majesty the emperor” with a Cantonese accent.	黄桑，朕要你去办事。	Yellow mulberry, we command you to handle the matter.	黄桑，你这是在干什么？	Emperor, what are you doing?	黄桑，这件事情你要负责。	Your majesty, you are responsible for this matter.
汗	perspiration; sweat; CL:滴[di1],頭|头[tou2],身[shen1]; to be speechless (out of helplessness, embarrassment etc) (Internet slang used as an interjection)	他汗流浃背。	He is sweating profusely.	她听完后，只能无语流汗。	After listening, she could only be speechless.	汗，这件事情真是让人无语。	Sweat, this matter is really speechless.
word	meanings	example sentence 1	translation 1	example sentence 2	translation 2	example sentence 3	translation 3
民宿	property rented via Airbnb or similar platform; guesthouse; bed-and-breakfast; homestay; pension	我们在海边租了一家民宿。	We rented a guesthouse by the sea.	这个民宿的环境非常舒适。	The environment of this homestay is very comfortable.	他们选择了一家民宿度过假期。	They chose a bed-and-breakfast for their vacation.
扶墻	v. To support myself by holding onto the wall. This Internet slang term describes one’s shock at something that rendered himself or herself unsteady.	他走路的时候扶墙扶得很厉害。	He walks while supporting himself by holding onto the wall.	她看到惊人的消息时差点扶墙。	She almost supported herself by holding onto the wall when she saw the shocking news.	听到那个消息，他差点扶墙。	He almost supported himself by holding onto the wall when he heard the news.
香	fragrant; sweet smelling; aromatic; savory or appetizing; (to eat) with relish; (of sleep) sound; perfume or spice; joss or incense stick; CL:根[gen1]	这道菜闻起来很香。	This dish smells very fragrant.	她用了一些香水。	She used some perfume.	他们在庙里点了一根香。	They lit an incense stick in the temple.
所	actually; place; classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc; that which; particle introducing a relative clause or passive; CL:個|个[ge4]	这所房子很漂亮。	This house is very beautiful.	我去了一所新学校。	I went to a new school.	他在所里工作。	He works in the institution.
老濕	n. Always+wet. Teacher. This Internet slang term and 老師 [lǎo shī] “teacher” are homophones, but it is often used to refer to a lecherous male teacher.	他是我们学校的老湿。	He is the lecherous teacher in our school.	这个老湿总是对女学生很暧昧。	This lecherous teacher is always ambiguous with female students.	别和那个老湿说话。	Don't talk to that lecherous teacher.
大事	major event; major political event (war or change of regime); major social event (wedding or funeral); (do sth) in a big way; CL:件[jian4],樁|桩[zhuang1]	这是一个大事，我们需要好好准备。	This is a major event, we need to prepare well.	他们在家里举办了一个大事。	They held a major social event at home.	她总是把小事当成大事。	She always treats small matters as major events.
闹	noisy; cacophonous; to make noise; to disturb; to vent (feelings); to fall ill; to have an attack (of sickness); to go in (for some activity); to joke	孩子们在院子里闹得很开心。	The children are playing noisily in the yard.	他们的争吵闹得很大。	Their quarrel made a lot of noise.	她总是喜欢闹着玩。	She always likes to play around.
批	to ascertain; to act on; to criticize; to pass on; classifier for batches, lots, military flights; tier (for the ranking of universities and colleges)	老师批了我的作业。	The teacher criticized my homework.	他们批准了我们的申请。	They approved our application.	这批货物已经到达了。	This batch of goods has arrived.
批	to ascertain; to act on; to criticize; to pass on; classifier for batches, lots, military flights; tier (for the ranking of universities and colleges)	老师批了我的作业。	The teacher criticized my homework.	他们批准了我们的申请。	They approved our application.	这批货物已经到达了。	This batch of goods has arrived.
花式虐狗	v. Fancy+abuse+dogs. To hurt the feelings of single people [single dogs] knowingly or unknowingly through myriad forms of public display of affection.	他们在公共场合大秀恩爱，简直是花式虐狗。	They publicly display affection in a fancy way, which is simply hurting the feelings of single people.	她总是在朋友圈里晒恩爱，有点花式虐狗。	She always shows off her affection in the circle of friends, a bit like fancy abuse of single people.	这种行为就是花式虐狗。	This behavior is simply fancy abuse of single people.

批	to ascertain; to act on; to criticize; to pass on; classifier for batches, lots, military flights; tier (for the ranking of universities and colleges)	老师批了我的作业。	The teacher criticized my homework.	他们批准了我们的申请。	They approved our application.	这批货物已经到达了。	This batch of goods has arrived.
错	mistake; wrong; bad; interlocking; complex; to grind; to polish; to alternate; to stagger; to miss; to let slip; to evade; to inlay with gold or silver	他犯了一个错误。	He made a mistake.	这是一个严重的错误。	This is a serious mistake.	她总是错过机会。	She always misses the opportunity.
大表哥	n. The eldest cousin brother. This Internet slang term is an affectionate nickname for British actor Dan Stevens, because of his role on Downton Abbey.	大表哥演得很好。	Dan Stevens acted very well.	我很喜欢大表哥在《唐顿庄园》里的角色。	I really like Dan Stevens' role in "Downton Abbey".	大表哥的表演让人印象深刻。	Dan Stevens' performance is impressive.
先	beforehand; first; earlier; at first; originally; for the time being; for now; (prefix) my late (in referring to deceased relatives older than oneself)	我先去超市，然后去银行。	I'll go to the supermarket first, then to the bank.	先生，请您先坐一会儿。	Sir, please have a seat first.	先别急，我们慢慢来。	Let's not rush, take it slowly.
咱们	we or us (including both the speaker and the person(s) spoken to); (dialect) I or me; (dialect) (in a coaxing or familiar way) you; also pr. [za2 men5]	咱们一起去吃饭吧。	Let's go eat together.	咱们明天一起去看电影吧。	Let's go watch a movie together tomorrow.	咱们都是好朋友。	We are all good friends.
照	according to; in accordance with; to shine; to illuminate; to reflect; to look at (one's reflection); to take (a photo); photo; as requested; as before	照医生的话，多休息是最重要的。	According to the doctor, getting plenty of rest is the most important thing.	她照了一张照片。	She took a photo.	照镜子的时候，她发现了一些皱纹。	When looking in the mirror, she found some wrinkles.
逗	to tease (playfully); to entice; (coll.) to joke; (coll.) funny; amusing; to stay; to sojourn; brief pause at the end of a phrase (variant of 讀|读[dou4])	他逗了她一下，她生气了。	He teased her a little, and she got angry.	这个笑话逗得大家都笑了。	This joke made everyone laugh.	他们逗留在海边度假了一个星期。	They stayed at the seaside for a week on vacation.
符合	in keeping with; in accordance with; tallying with; in line with; to agree with; to accord with; to conform to; to correspond with; to manage; to handle	这个答案符合我的预期。	This answer is in line with my expectations.	他的行为不符合规定。	His behavior does not conform to the regulations.	这个方案符合我们的要求。	This plan meets our requirements.
尬舞	(slang) to battle each other in street dancing (derived from Taiwanese 較, which sounds similar to Mandarin 尬[ga4]); (slang) to perform weird dance moves	他们在街头尬舞。	They battle each other in street dancing.	她很擅长尬舞。	She is very good at street dancing.	尬舞是一种很酷的舞蹈形式。	Street dancing is a very cool dance form.
狼系男	n. Wolflike man. A wolflike man is calm, domineering, committed, and a bit hard to control. This slang term is often used to label a type of boyfriends.	她的男朋友是个狼系男。	Her boyfriend is a wolflike man.	他有着典型的狼系男特质。	He has the typical traits of a wolflike man.	狼系男通常很有魅力。	Wolflike men are usually very charming.
word	meanings	example sentence 1	translation 1	example sentence 2	translation 2	example sentence 3	translation 3
雙標狗	n. Double standard+dog. A double-standard dog. This Internet slang term is a derogatory term for people who are considered practicing a double standard.	他是个典型的雙標狗，对自己要求严格，对别人却放任不管。	He is a typical double standard dog, strict with himself but lenient with others.	别成为一个雙標狗，要对所有人一视同仁。	Don't be a double standard dog, treat everyone equally.	那个政客被指责为雙標狗，因为他的言行不一。
不服來戰	<Expression> If you are not convinced, come and fight [come argue with me]. This expression is often used to show one’s confidence about one’s argument.	我觉得我的观点很有道理，不服來戰！	I think my point is very reasonable, come argue with me if you don't agree!	他总是自信满满地说不服來戰，但很少有人真的敢和他争论。	He always confidently says "come argue with me", but few people dare to argue with him.	她对自己的观点非常有信心，每次都说不服來戰。
抖機靈	<Expression> Shake+cleverness. Make a wisecrack. This expression is used slightly negatively to describe people who quip to show off how witty they are.	他总是在别人讲话的时候抖機靈，显得很烦人。	He always makes wisecracks when others are talking, which is annoying.	她并不喜欢别人在严肃的场合抖機靈。	She doesn't like it when people make wisecracks in serious situations.	不要总是抖機靈，有时候认真一点更好。
鼓动	to urge (an activity that may be beneficial, harmful or neutral); to encourage; to agitate; to instigate; to incite; to beat; to flap (wings, a fan etc)	他一直在鼓动大家参加慈善活动。	He has been encouraging everyone to participate in charity events.	政治鼓动可能会导致社会动荡。	Political instigation may lead to social unrest.	她的演讲鼓动了人们的爱国心。	Her speech has aroused people's patriotism.
不要不要	<Expression> No! No! This phrase is originally related to Japanese porn movies. 萌得不要不要的 Unbearably cute that it makes you say “No! No!” or “Stop! Stop!”	那只小猫萌得不要不要的，简直太可爱了！	That little cat is unbearably cute, it's just too adorable!	她的宠物狗萌得不要不要的，每个人都喜欢它。	Her pet dog is so cute that everyone loves it.	这部动画片里的小精灵萌得不要不要的，让人忍不住想要抱抱它。
锦上添花	lit. add flowers to brocade (idiom); fig. to give sth additional splendor; to provide the crowning touch; (derog.) to benefit sb who is already well off	他的奢侈行为就像锦上添花，让人很不满。	His extravagant behavior is like adding flowers to brocade, which is very dissatisfying.	这些奖励对他来说就是锦上添花，根本不需要。	These rewards are just adding flowers to brocade for him, totally unnecessary.	对于他们来说，这些额外的奖励只是锦上添花。
開車	v. To drive a car. To talk dirty. The Internet slang term often describes harmless dirty jokes which probably would not be considered sexual harrassment.	他总是在朋友圈里开車，让大家哈哈大笑。	He always talks dirty in his social circle, making everyone laugh.	她的幽默开車让大家轻松了很多。	Her humorous dirty jokes have lightened the mood for everyone.	他的开車总是让人捧腹大笑。
躁起來	<Expression> Get excited. Quoted from the song “Miss Dong” by Song Dongye, this expression is used to encourage people to become excited about something.	今天的气氛很好，大家都躁起來了。	The atmosphere today is very good, everyone is getting excited.	她的演讲让观众躁起來，纷纷鼓掌。	Her speech got the audience excited, and they all applauded.	这个消息让粉丝们躁起來了，纷纷表达了自己的兴奋之情。
敷衍	to elaborate (on a theme); to expound (the classics); perfunctory; to skimp; to botch; to do sth half-heartedly or just for show; barely enough to get by	他的回答太敷衍了，根本没有解决问题。	His answer was too perfunctory, it didn't solve the problem at all.	老板对员工的批评显得有些敷衍。	The boss's criticism of the employees seemed a bit perfunctory.	她的解释太敷衍了，没有说清楚。
污力滔滔	<Expression> Pouring out dirtiness in a steady flow. This expression is used to describe people who like talking about sex either directly or indirectly.	他总是污力滔滔地说些下流的笑话。	He always talks about dirty jokes in a steady flow.	她的言谈总是污力滔滔，让人很反感。	Her way of speaking is always pouring out dirtiness, which is very off-putting.	不要总是污力滔滔，有时候要注意自己的言辞。	Don't always talk about sex, sometimes you need to pay attention to your words.
word	meanings	example sentence 1	translation 1	example sentence 2	translation 2	example sentence 3	translation 3
作为	one's conduct; deed; activity; accomplishment; achievement; to act as; as (in the capacity of); qua; to view as; to look upon (sth as); to take sth to be	他作为团队的领导者，做出了很多贡献。	He has made many contributions as the leader of the team.	我将作为你的导师，全力支持你的研究。	I will support your research wholeheartedly as your mentor.	我们应该作为朋友来帮助彼此。	We should help each other as friends.
你	you (Note: In Taiwan, 妳 is used to address females, but in mainland China, it is not commonly used. Instead, 你 is used to address both males and females.)	你今天看起来很开心。	You look very happy today.	你能帮我一下吗？	Could you help me?	你们两个是我的好朋友。	You two are my good friends.
大体	in general; more or less; in rough terms; basically; on the whole; overall situation; the big picture; cadaver for dissection in training medical students	大体上，这个计划是可行的。	On the whole, this plan is feasible.	他大体了解了这个问题的重要性。	He basically understands the importance of this issue.	大体情况是什么？	What is the overall situation?
右	(bound form) right; right-hand side; (bound form) (politics) right of center; (bound form) (old) west; (literary) the right side as the side of precedence	请往右拐。	Please turn right.	他的政治立场偏向右翼。	His political stance leans towards the right.	右手拿着画笔，左手拿着调色板。	He holds the brush in his right hand and the palette in his left hand.
戲精	n. Drama+spirit. An attention-seeking person with a histrionic display of emotions and/or opinions. This Internet slang term is sometimes used humorously.	她总是装出一副戏精的样子。	She always puts on a histrionic act.	别再当戏精了，这里需要认真对待。	Stop being a drama queen, we need to take this seriously.	他的戏精表演让大家捧腹大笑。	His histrionic performance made everyone laugh heartily.
